diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Squamous-cell carcinoma involving the skull base
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Infectious processes (e.g., opportunistic infections, subacute bacterial endocarditis, intracranial tuberculoma)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with fever and progressive bilateral cranial-nerve palsies shortly after treatment for squamous-cell carcinoma. Despite ruling out recurrent cancer via imaging and lack of signs typical for locoregional recurrence, the cranial nerve involvement and imaging findings indicated a process involving the skull base. Opportunistic infections were considered due to the patient's immunocompromised status, leading to a recommendation for biopsy to ascertain the definitive diagnosis.
